messages.subject: Re: science sites
messages.msgSnippet: ... around the ... Howdy, These are all sites about optical illusions, they sort of fit the science category! http://www.eyetricks.com/
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., staclarspr@a... wrote:
> I am looking for new sites that contain science. Also using items
around the
> house,
> as experiments.
> I would appreciate any links that you have found interesting.
>
> Stac

Howdy,

These are all sites about optical illusions, they sort of fit the
science category!


http://www.eyetricks.com/

http://www.optillusions.com/
http://www.optillusions.com/43.html - is a sub page that I find
fascinating!

http://www.grand-illusions.com/

http://members.aol.com/Ryanbut/optical.html

http://www.sandlotscience.com/



Bridget

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] science sites
messages.msgSnippet: Check out this site also   http://groups.yahoo.com/group/krampf/ he has a lot of real good ideas on home products that you can use for science and he also has
messages.messageBody:
Check out this site also http://groups.yahoo.com/group/krampf/

he has a lot of real good ideas on home products that you can use for science and he also has a weekly science newsletter.

hsing parents Charles and Young to 2dds Sasha (13), Stella (11) and ds Charles III (9)

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] science sites
messages.msgSnippet: A fun site to check out is http://www.brainpop.com/ It s not very technical and I m not sure it has many experiments to try, but my kids enjoy watching the
messages.messageBody:
A fun site to check out is http://www.brainpop.com/
It's not very technical and I'm not sure it has many experiments to try, but my kids enjoy watching the different movies there and other stuff.

Karin




I am looking for new sites that contain science. Also using items around the
house,
as experiments.
I would appreciate any links that you have found interesting.

Stac
